interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey (Blu-ray)
Review Date: 2013/04/22
Store: Ian McKellen  (Actor),     Martin Freeman  (Actor),     Peter Jackson  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ['The adventure follows the journey of title character Bilbo Baggins, who is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor from the fearsome dragon Smaug. Approached out of the blue by the wizard Gandalf the Grey, Bilbo finds himself joining a company of thirteen dwarves led by the legendary warrior, Thorin Oakenshield. Their journey will take them into the Wild; through treacherous lands swarming with Goblins and Orcs, deadly Wargs and Sorcerers. Although their goal lies to the East and the wastelands of the Lonely Mountain, first they must escape the goblin tunnels, where Bilbo meets the creature that will change his life forever Gollum. Here, alone with Gollum, on the shores of an underground lake, the unassuming Bilbo Baggins not only discovers depths of ingenuity and courage that surprise even him, he also gains possession of Gollum\'s "precious" ring that holds unexpected and useful qualities A simple, gold ring that is tied to the fate of all Middle-earth in ways Bilbo cannot begin to know. ©2013 Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. THE HOBBIT: AN UNEXPECTED JOURNEY and THE HOBBIT, names of the characters, items, events and places therein are trademarks of The Saul Zaentz Company d/b/a Middle-earth Enterprises under license to New Line Productions, Inc. All rights reserved.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Science Fiction & Fantasy, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Blu-ray, Blu-ray, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Elijah Wood, Ken Stott, Christopher Lee, Hugo Weaving, Andy Serkis, Peter Jackson, Martin Freeman, James Nesbitt, Cate Blanchett, Richard Armitage, Ian McKellen, Ian HolmElijah Wood, Ken Stott, Christopher Lee, Hugo Weaving, Andy Serkis, Peter Jackson, Martin Freeman, James Nesbitt, Cate Blanchett, Richard Armitage, Ian McKellen, Ian Holm   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 49 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 3.53 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'NEWL1000296468BR', 'Director': 'Peter Jackson', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Blu-ray, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 49 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 19, 2013', 'Actors': 'Ian McKellen, Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage, James Nesbitt, Ken Stott', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'French, English, Spanish', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: I am biased because I am a recovering LOTR addict.  This was litter and funnier than LOTR.  I loved the dwarves!  I am pretty sure I have a secret dwarf crush on Fili and Kili (I don't actually know how to spell their names).  Bilbo and Smegel were both amusing.  I've already watched this twice!
Review Title: It's A-mazing
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ralph Hemecker', 'Ron Underwood', 'Dean White', 'Romeo Tirone', 'Steve Pearlman', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Billy Gierhart', 'David Solomon', 'Milan Cheylov', 'Alrick Riley'], 'Studio': ['ABC']}
I had accidentally deleted this episode from my dvr and the rest of the series kept recording, but I couldn't watch it until I had watched this one.  We couldn't find it anywhere for free and finally bought it on Amazon.  It was fast and good quality.
You need this episode to keep going in the series

['The adventure follows the journey of title character Bilbo Baggins, who is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor from the fearsome dragon Smaug. Approached out of the blue by the wizard Gandalf the Grey, Bilbo finds himself joining a company of thirteen dwarves led by the legendary warrior, Thorin Oakenshield. Their journey will take them into the Wild; through treacherous lands swarming with Goblins and Orcs, deadly Wargs and Sorcerers. profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Consumption**: Strong preference for serialized content; values uninterrupted viewing experiences and narrative continuity, as evidenced by emotional investment in series and recent enjoyment of a film adaptation of a literary classic.
- **Viewing Languages**: English as the primary language for both audio and subtitles, with some openness to dubbed content in other languages.
- **Purchase Behavior**: Willing to pay for content when access is not available for free; demonstrates a strong inclination towards high-quality physical formats, such as Blu-ray, ensuring immediate availability and superior viewing experiences.
- **Quality Expectations**: High standards for viewing quality; satisfaction with well-produced content is crucial, as reflected in recent favorites that blend humor and adventure.
- **Emotional Engagement**: Deeply engaged with characters and storytelling, finding humor and relatability in the narratives; this emotional connection enhances replay value.
- **Platform Preferences**: Favors online platforms that provide quick and seamless access to content, celebrating films and series that balance action, adventure, and character development.

This user exhibits consistent tendencies towards prioritizing quality, accessibility, and emotional resonance in their viewing habits, with a specific fondness for adaptations of beloved literary works, complemented by a passion for detailed narratives and engaging characters.
